It's not 100% accurate and I've had a few times of waiting for a bus that it said was arriving that didn't, but I don't believe those were the fault of the app.

Review.title: Terrible
Review.comment: As a long time bus rider this app is terrible. Recently had to start using the bus again and live right in front of a stop. Decided to pull this app up and it tells me my bus is on scheduled arrival in 4 minutes. So I grab my jacket and head out. After sitting there for a few minutes waiting for my bus to come down my neighborhood, I see it leaving up the back! Then I check the app and it says it departed my stop 3 minutes prior, on time. The next one doesn't come for another 30minutes. Making me late!

App hangs as soon as it is opened to the map page and displays the error, "OneBusAway has stopped." Cleared cache, uninstalled/reinstalled, rebooted phone. Running on OnePlus One running CynaogenOS (official) v.13.1.2-ZNH2Ka3PO-bacon). Just posting here to notify, will revise rating as soon as there's a fix. Thanks! Update: excellent support from OneBus, changing themes from Hexo resolves this issue.

Review.author: Ian Palmgren
Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Finally! An Exemplary App
Review.comment: Although the functionality of OBA has always been fantastic, I spent years in jealousy of iOS and how much better their version of the app looked. Well, finally the tables have turned and the Android app far surpasses iOS (in my opinion). With this visual overhaul, I felt compelled to share how great this is. Looks great, works perfectly, and is an absolute must have for anyone using public transport in Seattle. Great work guys!

Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Incredibly Helpful
Review.comment: Trying to figure out the best bus route before leaving for work/school can be pretty difficult, but this app makes it so much easier. I really like the "plan a trip" feature. I would like if they added some kind of alert that would tell you when your stop is coming up, but other than that I can't think of anything that could be changed. Overall, a great app!

Review.author: Meek Mill
Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Review.author: Joel Vancil
Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Great from inception, better every update
Review.comment: If you regularly use transit in one of the cities it covers, download this app to massively improve your quality of life. ... Now for TL;DR: Every schedule, route, and stop for every King County Metro or Sound Transit vehicle in my pocket. Realtime info on how off-schedule those vehicles are, based on radioed odometer data. All of the above integrated seamlessly with a handy map of the service area. Regular updates, mostly for the hard, thankless task of fixing bugs. It doesn't get better than this, folks.

Review.author: Teresa Hall

Review.comment: I love the app since I take the bus to work. But this last update has caused a problem with my list of starred stops. The screen only shows the top edge of each line, so I can't read the stop name. I have to click on each and see the actual times in order to see the stop name. Update: sent you a screenshot Update: Developer responded, and the next time they updated the app, my problem was also fixed. I really love this!

Google maps is more effective at routing without even trying.

Review.author: Lindsay Crain
Review.star: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Review.comment: I've used the iOS version on my iPod for years, and it has been vital for me. Not having access without wi-fi, I can't speak to how accurate arrivals have been, but it was useful for telling me when to leave the house and how to plan my trips. Today I finally got a smartphone and I am really confused by how different the Android version is. The apple version has tabs listing recent and bookmarked stops. The latter has been ESSENTIAL for being able to look at connecting buses when I have a route with transfers. But this version only gives me a map. I have to search for the next stop every time, and if I'm still far away, or don't remember the exact street... what a hassle. Not to mention that I can't easily switch between two stops (because sometimes I have a choice about which bus to take depending on which will arrive sooner between stops that are only a block apart.) And I notice that the view for the stops have a star I can add at the top, so there SEEMS to still be favourites, but how can I view them? I really need those tabs back and then I can put the stars back on this review.

I tried to submit this through "report a problem", but apparently that doesn't work either.

Sometimes it says a bus will be 20 minutes late, but it leaves 5 minutes early. Sometimes it says it will leave on time, but the bus is 15 minutes late. You can't even ballpark a general time. The app is right so infrequently that it's useless.

Review.author: Andrew Ko
Review.star: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Review.comment: Edit: actual practicality of this app is minimal, due to latency between gps fetching and actual bus time arrivals. Even when buses are late (or on time) bus drivers often compensate to reach the destination at the prescribed time. Thus it would be no different if not more safe with the actual timetable of the route than this app (that is, if you try and get to a bus stop even almost "exactly" on time, you will miss many a bus!)

Lastly something I know you might not be able to do is have a bus icon on the map that moves in real-time. That plus the "satellite" view would be really cool.

The android app does not do this. For me, it's important information. Please put it in!!

Review.title: Still crashes phone fairly frequently
Review.comment: I wrote a review a while back in September that I accidentally deleted when I went to update it today (January). This app, while useful, still has the very annoying feature that it often crashes my phone when I click the back button on the 'list of coming buses' page for a given bus stop. It restarts the entire phone, so there is no opportunity to submit a bug report. None of the app updates have fixed this issue, at least not permanently. While the crashes are ultimately just an inconvenience, if Google ever implements decent real-time bus tracking in Google Maps for Seattle, I don't think I would keep using this app.

I use it almost every day.

Review.author: J Howard Boyd
Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Essential app
Review.comment: This app is essential in navigating Seattle's bus system. When Metro's geo-location system is working at top form, this app gives very accurate info for when and where your next bus is. If the app cannot access Metro's geo-location system it will show you only scheduled times, but this is not the fault of the app, and is actually better than just saying, "data not available", as earlier versions did. Constantly improving with each update and glitches are quickly fixed. This is my most used app.

Also, the favorites pages should be more accessible while using the app, like in the menu bar at the top. The app functions great for finding bus times for new stops, but does not function as well for commuters who will only want to reference one page.

Review.comment: If you use public transit as your primary mode-of-transportation, get this app. Before you walk all the way to that next stop, check the one youre at to make sure another one isn't coming by for a while. It also helps for unique service days like holidays and rerouting.

Review.author: A Google User
Review.star: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Okay app most the time but be careful on holidays
Review.comment: Been using this app for a couple weeks now and it usually works well for the buses I ride (245, 255, 545). But had a bad experience on Thanksgiving Day where it showed the standard weekday schedule, not the Sunday schedule which it was on because of the holiday. Even if this was just a one-off oversight, it significantly reduced my confidence in the app and from now on I'll double check the King County Metro timetables before heading out the door. The only other small complaint is the map automatically centers to your current location. This makes sense the first time you go to map view, but if you've panned and zoomed the map to another area to check out its stops, when you return to the map, it should be where you left it. Since it auto-centers, it makes it really frustrating to research stops/routes that you may not be near at that moment. To end on a positive note, I do like the ability to add shortcuts to my starred bus stops/routes to my home screen.

Use Google Maps to look up which route, then check the stop arrival time on OneBus.

Review.author: A Google User
Review.star: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Great resource; too network-dependent
Review.comment: This app is a huge help for checking out bus status, routes, and such. My only complaint is how little info is stored locally: if you aren't able to get a signal, it becomes almost completely useless because you can't view routes, stops, or even the timetables. If this contained all the info on routes and stops with it, or allowed you to download the timetables for specific busses and stops, it would be a perfect reference guide. As it is, it's very good if you have a data plan and/or constant wifi access.

Review.author: A Google User
Review.star: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Not that reliable
Review.comment: For the 14, you are more wrong then right. In the evening you have it's departure time as the time it arrives for . It actually doesn't leave for another 10 mins or more. May 1st at Pike & 6th in have the departure time at 6:42pm. Then at 6:35pm it changed to 6:47pm. Then changed at 6:40pm to 6:57pm (the scheduled departure). The 14 is not alone. There are MANY other routes that you are not accurate with. As more routes get GPS, I hope you accuracy gets better.

Review.author: A Google User
Review.star: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Not great
Review.comment: The user interface could use some work. I just want to see a list of the stops I normally use when start the app. Instead, it always starts by showing a map and I have to hit menu, and then My Stops to get to the list of my stops. Sometimes it shows departure times that don't actually exist. This morning it showed MT-346 at Aurora Village at 9:00. The 346 bus came a couple minutes after 9:00, but they pulled over into the parking lane and shut off the engine, so I checked the schedule on the Metro website. The next bus was not scheduled until 9:17. It must be showing what time the bus gets there, regardless of when the next departure time is. What good is that? I only care about when the bus is going to leave. I guess it's not really designed to work if you're catching a bus at a transit center where the bus might be there, but the driver might stop to take their break or something.

Review.author: A Google User
Review.star: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Very useful, but awkward interface.
Review.comment: In general, I think this is a useful app, and I use it all the time. It's quite accurate most of the time, but occasionally buses never show up or the schedule is way off, which is likely not a problem with the app, but from the data feed they receive. My biggest complaint with the app is that it splits many routes into sections, so it only displays part of the route. This is even the case when the route number doesn't change. When it displays the route, it shows it come to end at some point, when in reality it continues. The app knows this information, because under 'Show route information' it will show the route broken up into sections, but you can't display it that way, and you have to dig around to even find that much. The iPhone version has a way to display the other section, but you have to scroll to the bottom of the list of stops. Not at all obvious. The interface is very confusing. It's much better on the iPhone. I find myself constantly clicking around trying to figure out how to get the information I'm looking for. The iPhone version is much more intuitive. A complete UI overhaul is needed, but the core functionality is good.
